raw_response:
SUMMARY:
This individual displays a strong preference for high-quality, engaging entertainment, particularly in the crime and sci-fi genres. Consistent ratings suggest a favorable view toward narratives with violence and substance themes, indicating an affinity for intense and dramatic storytelling. Their highest ratings (5.0) frequently accompany strongly positive sentiments about the first seasons of shows, while later seasons often receive lower ratings, indicating a pattern of disappointment with declining quality over time.

They gravitate towards series with intriguing plots and complex characters, particularly appreciating family-oriented viewing experiences. Price sensitivity appears low, as the consumer is willing to invest in premium formats, such as UHD, suggesting a value placed on high-quality production.

Overall, the core preferences reflect a desire for stimulating content with rich storytelling that sustains quality, especially in the earlier stages of a series, alongside a willingness to overlook imperfections in favor of humor or thematic depth. Their reviews signal both appreciation and disappointment, emphasizing the importance of maintaining consistent quality throughout a show's lifespan.

target_interaction.title: More human than cat.
target_interaction.text: I found myself wanting a lot more cat content, because its mainly about the humans. That being said, I still enjoyed the documentary.
description: Wildcat follows the inspiring story of a young veteran on his journey into the Amazon. Once there, he meets a young woman running a wildlife rescue and rehabilitation center, and his life finds new meaning as he is entrusted with the life of an orphaned baby ocelot. What was meant to be an attempt to escape from life, turns out to be an unexpected journey of love, discovery, and healing.
